korakhattiya.comments: [deepseek: deepseek-chat] Compound of 'kora' (bow-legged/lame) and 'khattiya' (nobleman), likely describing a nobleman with a physical disability.

sañjitā.comments: [deepseek: deepseek-chat] The word is a feminine past participle derived from 'sañjānāti' (to perceive). The context suggests it refers to something that has been perceived or recognized.

ativyādippissanti.meaning_2: will transgress; will overstep; will violate
ativyādippissanti.comments: [deepseek: deepseek-chat] The future tense form suggests a warning or prediction about future transgressions.
